name: Hostal Dr Lara y Sra Yuda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in January 2012 and booked in advance through Hostelbookers. We received an email from Jorge, the owner, after booking to confirm and then we emailed him again to ask if someone could meet us at the Viazul bus station as we had heard it was easy to get taken to alternative casas as a scam. Waiting at the bus station was a very smiley bicycle taxi boy with a sign with our name on it, so it was very stress free us in the pandemonium at the bus station.
reviews.title: Highly recommended casa with friendly hosts and lovely food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't have got a warmer welcome from Yuda, Jorge's wife, who was standing at the front door waiting for us as we were dropped off after the fun 3 minute journey through the colourful streets of Trinidad. Her English isn't fluent but that really didn't present a problem at all as we managed to communicate very well. She was the right mix of very friendly and helpful but leaving you to get on with your holiday.
reviews.title: Lovely Casa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have 2 rooms and are both are furnished simply with ensuite bathrooms. The room and bathroom were very clean, as was the entire casa. You get your own key, there is a safe in your bedroom wall and there are 2 areas to sit outside the room - at the rear of the building under a palapa (which is where we ate) or on the roof terrace - ideal for catching the sunshine. Water is help yourself from the fridge at $1CUC a 500ml bottle.
reviews.title: Best Casa In Cuba

reviews.text: We ate breakfast and dinner at the Casa and it was delicious, fresh and huge portions. We had grilled fish, lobster and chicken on the 3 nights and all were very good indeed. Breakfast would be fresh orange juice, Cuban coffee, fruit slices, pancakes with honey, eggs and cheeses and ham. I can't remember the exact prices of the meals but I think the evening meals were $10CUCs each which was good value we thought.
reviews.title: lovely place to stay.

reviews.text: In summary, if you want a good value b&b with friendly hosts and delicious food in central Trinidad, stay here. If you can't speak Spanish don't worry, we're useless at it and we coped very well!
reviews.title: Great place to stay and superb breakfast & dinner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Hostal Dra Lara & Sra Yuda for five nights in the end of December 2010. Sra Yuda´s food was delicious and the family showed great hospitality so we felt like home.
reviews.title: Lovely casa & great hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: New Year´s Eve they invited us to a gathering with the family with delicious food, dancing and great fellowship.
reviews.title: Fantastic casa, friendly place, lovely food, comfortable & quiet, great value

reviews.text: The room was nice, clean and well equipped.
reviews.title: stay away from the Hostal Dr. Lara y Sra Yuda!

reviews.text: Hostal Dr Lara & Sra Yuda is centrally located in Trinidad, within walking distance from the city centre.
reviews.title: THIS IS THE BEST CASA - don't look any further!

reviews.text: We will highly recommend this casa to other travellers.
reviews.title: A very enjoyable stay!

reviews.text: We stayed at this house for 3 night and then 2 nigths at a hotel in Ancon but would have stayed at the house and travelled to the beach instead had we known how lovely Trinidad was, and how much better the food was too.
reviews.title: Loved Trinidad and this house was the perfect base
We felt very much at home at this friendly place!
reviews.text: Yuda is a lovely warm and caring lady and she is helped by a team of ladies who are also lovely (thank you Damaris) and hardworking.
The house is kept inmaculately clean. The food is good and plentiful (people it is posible to get nice food in Cuba, take my work, you just need to knwo where to find it)
reviews.title: comfortable,clean, historic, warm home

reviews.text: Price is goo. Location is not exactly in the center but within 10 min walk from main square which means it is nice and quiet and not a problem at all.
reviews.title: Wonderfull Cuban vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For my sons birthady they arranged for a cake to be delivered and we all sat together and ate it.
reviews.title: Go!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This casa is well worth a visit look no further. Location is five min from casa de musica and it is very safe we returned to casa early hours 3-4 am with no problems. Courtyard and roof terrace very beautiful to eat and relax in. Food was really good and a great variety was offered every morning for the day. The room was large bright and clean, tiled bathroom plenty of hot. Trinidad is a lovely town we had four nights hereand felt this was enough. A must do is the steam train ride Yuda will direct you to train station were you can buy a ticket leaving at 9.30am go early to look around yard also and ask if you can sit in engine room. The waterfall walk was also good however a good pair of walking shoes/boots are required. Go to Trinidad and stay in this casa and enjoy.
reviews.title: Home from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very comfortable room, cool and quiet, spotlessly clean. charming and very helpful hosts, nice meals, especially delicious breakfasts and easy walking distance of everywhere. If its running, take the steam train out to Valle de los Ingenios, a five minute walk to the train stop (hesitate to say station...). A great choice when visiting Trinidad.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Yuda and her husband Dr Jorge Lara were great hosts in their lovely clean and spacious home. Meals are served under a palapa outdoors in one of 2 courtyards. very pleasant setting for very nice, overly abundant meals that are prepared nicely and served w/ grace. We ate all breakfasts and dinners in over our 4 night stay as the restaurants in town could not compete w/ the flavors and atmosphere. Quiet room w/ AC, was great w/ 2 double beds so we could share our room w/ our 20 yr old daughter. Also had a refrig in it which was nice. Trinidad is great and short taxi ride to Playa Ancon for some nice beach time.
reviews.title: Charming courtyard casa with great hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The house was very clean. Yuda made us fell at home. Breakfast and dinner were lovely. One of the best place in Trinidad to have nice meals.
reviews.title: Very nice place and excellent meals

reviews.text: We were a group of 4 people and we found this wonderful house through hostel brokers. From the very first time Juda made us feel like our home. The house is really wonderful with a beautiful yard. It's a colonial house, very clean and extremely safe. We ate there almost every day and the food was great. I strongly recommend the house for other visitors. And plan to stay in Trinidad more than 3 days. This city and its surroundings made my trip in cuba a great experience.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in Trinidad

description: Three rooms are produced acclimatized with private bathrooms, it dilutes cold and heat. In downtown. lending the following services.-gastronomy.-mini bar.-air conditioning.-laundry.-cocteleria.-children are accepted.-mascots are accepted.- telephone.-internet.Offering to the guest cleaning, comfor, and security.
